title: Trump announces 100% tariffs for movies produced outside US
content: Donald Trump's recent announcement of a 100% tariff on foreign-made films has sparked concerns about a potential trade war. Citing the decline of Hollywood and alleged propaganda, Trump aims to revitalize American movie production. However, this move adds to existing trade tensions, particularly with China, impacting global supply chains.

title: Supreme Court to decide today if interim order needed on waqf pleas
content: The Supreme Court will decide on Monday regarding interim orders on petitions challenging the Waqf Amendment Act, 2025, concerning its impact on traditional Islamic ties and religious freedom. The Centre defends the Act as secular, countering claims of religious interference and emphasizing the need to prevent misuse of the 2013 amendment, which allegedly led to encroachment on properties.

title: Special session of Punjab House today to discuss water release to Haryana
content: Punjab's assembly will convene a special session due to a water-sharing dispute with Haryana, triggered by the Centre's directive for Punjab to release additional water. Punjab is resisting, claiming it lacks surplus water, leading to escalated tensions ahead of annual water allocation. Political solidarity is seen in Punjab, while Haryana defends its demand, intensifying the conflict.

title: Warren Buffet says Apple under Cook has contributed to Berkshire more than ...
content: Warren Buffett lauded Tim Cook's leadership at Apple, acknowledging his significant contribution to Berkshire Hathaway's financial gains. Despite reducing Berkshire's Apple stake, Buffett emphasized Cook's unique ability to develop Apple, drawing a comparison to Steve Jobs. Since Cook became CEO in 2011, Apple's stock has surged, driving its market capitalization to over $3 trillion.

title: Caste census: Congress targets BJP with SC affidavit, Parl reply
content: Despite Congress's claim that PM Modi reversed his stance on caste enumeration due to their pressure, the party highlighted the government's 2021 decision against a caste census and its plea to the Supreme Court to avoid ordering one. Congress is now questioning Modi's apparent U-turn and directing state units to rally for caste census implementation and the removal of reservation barriers.

title: Rape by one of a gang makes others responsible, equally punishable: SC
content: The Supreme Court has affirmed that in gangrape cases, proving each accused committed the complete act of rape isn't necessary for conviction. The court emphasized that if one member of a group commits rape with shared intent, all involved are equally responsible and punishable under Section 376(2)(g) of IPC, highlighting the principle of joint liability based on common intention.

title: 2 years on, Telangana gig workers' Bill catches Rajasthan's landmark law 'napping'
content: Telangana's draft bill on gig workers revives the debate once led by Rajasthan, where a pioneering 2023 law remains stalled. Gig workers in Rajasthan struggle with low earnings and lack of social security, as the promised welfare measures face bureaucratic delays. Amidst this, a cooperative framework and union efforts offer a glimmer of hope for a more equitable future.

title: Ray Dalio says Donald Trump’s tariff war is pushing America close to a recession
content: Ray Dalio, who predicted the 2008 crisis, warns that mishandled economic policies, particularly Trump's tariffs, could push the U.S. into a recession. He likens the tariffs' disruptive implementation to destabilizing the production system. Despite a tariff pause, Goldman Sachs estimates a significant chance of a recession within the next year, highlighting growing economic uncertainty.

title: Excise duty difference in states defeats spirit of ‘1 nation, 1 tax’
content: Alcohol prices in India vary significantly across states due to differing excise duties and taxes, with Goa having the lowest levies. This disparity undermines the 'one nation, one tax' principle, encouraging bootlegging and revenue loss for high-tax states. Industry bodies advocate for tax rationalization to promote sustainable revenue growth and discourage excessive consumption, but finance ministers are hesitant to relinquish taxation powers.

title: BJP: Rahul Gandhi ridiculed not just in India, but globally
content: BJP has praised a Sikh student for questioning Rahul Gandhi about the 1984 Sikh massacre during an interaction at Brown University. The student challenged Gandhi on reconciliation efforts with the Sikh community, citing past Congress actions and impunity for leaders like Sajjan Kumar. BJP criticized Gandhi's response and also attacked him for referring to Lord Ram as a mythological figure during the same event.

title: Children rescued from 'house of horrors' hadn’t stepped out since 2021
content: In Spain, a couple faces imprisonment for allegedly confining their three sons indoors since 2021, driven by COVID-19 fears. Upon rescue, the children, aged eight and ten, displayed extreme reactions to the outside world. Authorities discovered appalling living conditions, including excessive trash and restricted toilet use. Read the article to know more.

title: Melinda Gates' advice to daughter after she cried over baby questions
content: Phoebe Gates, Bill Gates' daughter, revealed her mother Melinda's advice on handling investor bias regarding future motherhood while raising funds for her startup, Phia. Gates and her co-founder, Sophia Kianni, encountered questions about their plans to have children, highlighting a persistent bias in venture capital.

title: BSF to get 16 new battalions, 2 field HQs for Pakistan, Bangladesh borders
content: The paramilitary force has 193 battalions as of now to guard the two fronts. A battalion of the border force consists of over 1,000 troopers. Hence, the overall strength of the 16 new battalions will be around 17,000 personnel

title: Heavy rain brings respite from heat, but throws life out of gear in Vijayawada
content: Collector ensures NEET aspirants did not face any transportation issue, urges people to stay cautious

title: Boy dies after falling into overflowing drain in Machavaram
content: The boy reportedly fell in an overflowing drain. Local residents and the boy’s mother noticed Manikanta in the drain and shifted him to hospital, where the doctors declared him as ‘brought dead’

title: Telangana High Court judge Justice M.G. Priyadarsini passes away
content: The mortal remains of the judge were kept at Villa No. 14, Vasanth City, Hafeezpet. The last rites would be performed at 12 p.m. at Jubilee Hills Mahaprasthanam on May 5

title: Supreme Court to hear batch of pleas challenging Waqf (Amendment) Act today
content: The Centre assured the Supreme Court on April 17 that it would neither denotify waqf properties, including ‘waqf by user’, nor make any appointments to the Central Waqf Council and boards till May 5

title: Will remain in NDA, no more about turns: Nitish Kumar
content: The Bihar CM, who has changed partners several times, said, ‘My party made me go here and there a couple of times. But this won’t happen again. It was late Atal Bihari Vajpayee who made me (the CM)‘

title: Amid India-Pakistan tension, 30-minute blackout drill held at Ferozepur Cantonment
content: The BSF has intensified patrolling along the international border while Punjab Police has set up checkpoints at all strategic locations as a precautionary measure

title: AI-based imaging and research centre got inaugurated
content: The RADAR centre aims to enhance precision diagnostics through AI-enabled imaging, improving the accuracy of patient’s diagnosis and care

title: Broadway bus terminus in city awaits revamp
content: The ₹822.7-crore project is to transform the hub into a Multi-Modal Facility Complex; While CMDA waits for Corporation to hand over the site, civic officials say they have not received any file from it

title: T.N. Chief Minister to announce nationalisation of books of five Tamil scholars today
content: Stalin will attend the valedictory of ‘Tamil Week’. As part of this, various literary events were held across the State since April 29 to mark the birth anniversary of poet Pavendhar Bharathidasan

title: Centre announced caste census only after pressure from the Congress: Girish Chodankar
content: Speaking at a public meeting in Chennai, he says the the government at the Centre, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has ‘surrendered’ to the people

title: IAF chief briefs PM Modi on force's op readiness
content: Amid escalating tensions, the IAF chief briefed PM Modi on operational readiness, including long-range fighter sorties and heightened air defense. This meeting, following a similar briefing from the Navy chief, underscores India's preparedness for potential punitive strikes against Pakistan. The IAF is conducting regular combat air patrols and increasing operational readiness platforms, with Rafales equipped for swift action.

title: Jammu CRPF constable dismissed for marrying Pak cousin appeals for justice
content: CRPF constable Munir Ahmad was dismissed for allegedly concealing his marriage to a Pakistani woman, despite claiming he informed the department and his wife's long-term visa was pending. He appealed to PM Modi and Amit Shah, stating he followed procedures and the High Court acknowledged his wife's stay. Ahmad maintains his wife wasn't overstaying as her LTV application was under consideration.

title: Eyes on electronics imports from China
content: Amid import surge concerns, recent data indicates a drop in electronics exports from China to both India and the US in January and February. Despite Trump's tariffs, no significant surge in shipments from China and ASEAN has been observed.

title: Detained man ‘drowns trying to escape’, J&K government seeks judicial probe
content: Following the death of Imtiyaz Ahmad Magray, detained during a counter-terrorism operation after the Pahalgam attack, the J&K government is facing calls for a judicial inquiry. Magray's body was found in a river, with police claiming he drowned while attempting to escape. Political figures express concern over alleged custodial deaths and the potential for collective punishment in the region.

title: L&DO freeze on land conversion hits thousands
content: Thousands of Delhi residents are facing uncertainty as the Land and Development Office has halted leasehold to freehold property conversions for two and a half years, missing court-committed deadlines for new procedures and rates. This suspension has allegedly fueled corruption, with landowners pressured to pay extra for necessary NOCs, while the High Court has intervened, demanding explanations for the delays.

title: Rajnath Singh: 'Under PM Modi, you'll get the Pahalgam hitback you want'
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has assured India that a "befitting reply" will be given to those responsible for the Pahalgam massacre, indicating potential military action against Pakistan. He emphasized PM Modi's leadership and determination to fulfill the people's desires for retribution. This statement follows discussions with the US Secretary of Defence, where Singh highlighted Pakistan's role in supporting terrorism.

title: Road rage: E-rickshaw driver slashes cabbie's neck
content: In Delhi's Dabri area, an e-rickshaw driver, Rajendra, was arrested after he slashed a cab driver, Gagandeep Singh, in a road rage incident. Singh was attacked with a blade after a minor collision and is currently recovering. Police are investigating Rajendra's background for prior violent behavior. This incident follows another deadly road rage case in Ranhola where a motorcyclist was murdered after a dispute with an SUV driver.

title: Iran min to visit India & Pak; govt rules out mediation
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi is scheduled to visit Pakistan on Monday, followed by a trip to India later in the week. The visit occurs amidst heightened tensions between India and Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack. While in Pakistan, Araghchi will engage in discussions on bilateral relations and the regional situation, while the India visit is for a pre-scheduled joint commission meeting.

title: ICAR: World’s first genome-edited rice varieties to boost yields 30%
content: India's agricultural research body, ICAR, has developed two genome-edited rice varieties, 'DRR Dhan 100 (Kamala)' and 'Pusa DST Rice 1', promising a 20-30% yield increase. Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan anticipates a second green revolution with these climate-resilient, high-yielding crops. Expected to be available to farmers in two years, these varieties aim to save water, reduce methane emissions, and boost paddy production by 4.5 million tons across five million hectares.

title: President rule finds mention in Bengal guv’s report on Murshidabad violence
content: Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose's report to Amit Shah on Murshidabad communal strife suggests President's rule if the situation worsens. The report recommends a judicial inquiry and central intervention. Trinamool Congress criticizes the report as politically motivated. BJP supports intervention due to law-and-order concerns. Congress focuses on ensuring fair elections. The governor visited affected areas after mob violence and suggested CAPF camps in sensitive zones.

title: Deadline looming, MCD met just 21% of desilting target by end of April
content: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has completed only 21.3% of its drain desilting work by April 25, falling short of its May 31 deadline. Out of 1.3 lakh metric tonnes of silt targeted for removal, only 27,000 MT has been cleared from major drains. Residents report no desilting in their areas, leading to concerns about potential waterlogging during the monsoon season, further exposed by recent downpours.

title: 2 teens lynched after brawl over tandoori roti at Amethi wedding
content: In a shocking incident in Amethi, a dispute over tandoori rotis at a wedding escalated into a brutal lynching, resulting in the deaths of cousins Ashish, 17, and Ravi, 18. The young men were attacked with iron rods and lathis after a verbal spat at the food stall. Police have registered a case against 13 individuals and detained several suspects as investigations continue into this senseless act of violence.

title: NTA’s task, says HC, refuses to assess IIT aspirant’s score
content: The Bombay High Court has denied an IIT aspirant's plea to take the JEE (Advanced) exam after the National Testing Agency (NTA) flagged his JEE (Mains) scorecard as a 'case of unfair means' (UFM). The court upheld NTA's decision, finding no reason to doubt the agency's assessment or interfere with the UFM designation, while keeping open the option for the student to challenge his debarment separately.

title: Two men held in Punjab for leaking intel to Pakistani handlers
content: In Amritsar, Punjab Police arrested Phalak Sher Masih and Suraj Masih for allegedly leaking sensitive information and photographs of Indian military and security installations to Pakistani handlers. The duo, apprehended in Bahlarwal village, transmitted the data via WhatsApp and received payments for their actions. Investigations revealed their connection to a cross-border smuggler currently incarcerated in Amritsar Central Jail.

title: Band of BTech students in Andhra forced to double up as janitors
content: In Andhra Pradesh's Guntur, a group of determined female engineering students are working as janitors and performing other chores at their college to afford hostel fees. Coming from financially challenged backgrounds, these students willingly clean toilets, water plants, and assist in the kitchen to ease the burden on their families and continue their education.

title: NTA does it again, leaves 14L CUET-UG candidates without schedule, in limbo
content: Over 14 lakh candidates await the release of the subject-wise schedule for CUET-UG 2025, which is scheduled from May 8 to June 1. The NTA is yet to announce the exam dates and centre details, causing anxiety among aspirants. City intimation slips and admit cards are expected to be released soon on the official website.

title: Delay in commissioning Kommaghatta substation hampers power supply in NPKL
content: The Kommaghatta 66/11 KV substation, tendered in August 2021 and built at a cost of approximately ₹32 crore, was scheduled to be completed within 13 months

title: Delay in road projects to decongest Thripunithura draws flak from residents
content: Projects that are hanging fire include extension of the road that runs beneath the Kochi metro corridor to Hill Palace Road, and widening of S.N. Junction–Poothotta road; TRURA to launch stir

title: On SC’s Waqf hearing eve, DMK says 95% stakeholders before JPC was against amendments
content: On April 16, a Special Bench headed by CJI Khanna recorded an assurance by the government to neither denotify any waqf property, including waqf-by-user ones, nor make any appointment of non-Muslims to the Central Waqf Council or the States Waqf Boards

title: PM inaugurates seventh Khelo India Youth Games being held in Bihar
content: About 8,500 players will participate across 28 sports; the PM underscored the Games’ significance in providing a major platform for the nation’s youth; he urged visitors to sample Bihar’s famous litti chokha and makhana

title: Railway Protection Force seizes ganja worth ₹4.05 crore, liquor worth ₹13.16 lakh in crackdown on smuggling via rail
content: “Drug traffickers tend to misuse long-haul trains to shift narcotics across State lines, thinking they can evade detection due to the speed and anonymity the railway system offers,” said an SWR official

title: Victims of Murshidabad riots allege police broke doors, forcibly barged inside their premises
content: Parul Das wife of Hargobind Das and Pinki Das wife of Chandan Das sought protection and deployment of appropriate central forces for their safety and added that they were “left shaken and traumatized by the brazen conduct of the officers.

title: Youth’s body recovered from river in Kulgam; Mehbooba alleges ‘foul play’
content: Sources say victim helped in busting a hideout of militants recently; political parties demand a thorough investigation

title: Goa stampede: Fact-finding committee begins probe into incident; Governor meets victims’ kin
content: A police official said that the committee is currently recording the statements of senior officials in-charge of crowd management to understand what went wrong

title: Ranchi citizens write to CBFC Chairman Prasoon Joshi to clear ‘Santosh’ without any cuts
content: The viewers also issued an open letter to CBFC Chairman Prasoon Joshi to immediately allow the release of the film without any cuts. The open letter was signed by several renowned personalities including economist Jean Drèze.

title: Iran FM Araghchi to visit Pakistan, India this week, days after offering to mediate to reduce tensions
content: Iran’s Foreign Minister to hold Joint Commission Meeting with EAM Jaishankar in Delhi to discuss trade, Chabahar, U.S. sanctions

title: Echoes of 1971 as Ferozepur Cantt goes dark in 30-minute drill
content: Ferozepur Cantonment, near the India-Pakistan border, experienced a 30-minute blackout drill reminiscent of the 1971 War. Residents were informed beforehand about the exercise, which involved switching off all lights, including generators. Checkpoints were active, and hooters sounded, creating an atmosphere of emergency. The Cantonment Board stated the drill was a routine safety measure, thanking residents for their cooperation.

title: Punjab cuts supply, 8 Haryana districts face water crisis
content: Eight districts in Haryana are grappling with a severe drinking water crisis as Punjab refuses to release additional water from the Bhakra Dam. These districts, including Sirsa and Hisar, are receiving only 15% of their required water supply, leaving 156 waterworks tanks dry.

title: NEET-UG sees lowest attendance since 2021
content: NEET-UG 2025 witnessed a decline in attendance, recording 91.4% with 20.8 lakh candidates appearing out of 22.7 lakh registered, attributed to NTA's stringent checks to eliminate "bogus" candidates. Enhanced security measures, including mobile jammers and biometric authentication, were implemented across 5,453 exam centers. A centralized control room and coordinated efforts with various ministries ensured real-time monitoring and action against false information on social media.

title: Odisha to Bengal: Stop calling Digha temple Jagannath Dham
content: Odisha government plans to request West Bengal to stop referring to the Digha temple as "Jagannath Dham," sparking political disputes. Allegations of using Puri temple wood for Digha idols are under investigation, while craftsmen dismiss the claims. Opposition parties criticize the BJP for its handling of the sensitive issue, emphasizing the emotional connection of Odias to Jagannath culture.

title: Officials detain US couple at Lengpui, deport them over permit breach
content: Intelligence officials at Lengpui airport near Aizawl detained an American couple, Walter Frederick Kuhn and Sahron Clodfelter Kuhn, upon arrival for not possessing the mandatory Protected Area Permit (PAP). They were subsequently deported to the US on Saturday.

title: India's first AI-based data park to come up in Raipur
content: Chhattisgarh's Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai initiated the state's first AI-based Data Centre Park in Nava Raipur, featuring a unique 2.7-hectare SEZ for AI services. With a proposed investment of Rs 1,000 crore over two years, the project aims to transform the state into a digital hub, empowering youth, farmers, and tribal communities.

title: Bengal moves Supreme Court to modify order sacking teachers
content: The Bengal government and the SSC have filed a review petition in the Supreme Court, seeking modifications to the April 3 judgment that scrapped the 2016 recruitment panel. They aim to distinguish between tainted and untainted appointees, requesting clarifications on the new recruitment process. This action follows assurances from CM Mamata Banerjee to protesting teachers, with mixed reactions arising from those affected.

title: UK MPs demand release of jailed British Sikh facing terror charges in India
content: Over 100 UK MPs and peers are pressing Foreign Secretary David Lammy to intervene for the release of Jagtar Singh Johal, a British Sikh imprisoned in India since 2017 on terrorism charges. Despite an acquittal in one case due to lack of evidence, Johal remains detained, with concerns raised about torture and forced confessions.

title: Iyer named temp nominee to IMF board ahead of meet to decide on $1.3bn Pak aid
content: Parameswaran Iyer has been appointed as India's temporary nominee to the International Monetary Fund board, preceding a crucial meeting regarding a $1.3 billion support package for Pakistan. India opposes this funding due to concerns about Pakistan's alleged support for terrorism, particularly after the Pahalgam attack. This appointment follows the dismissal of Krishnamurthy Subramanian.

title: EC's single-point application set to integrate existing 40 apps, portals
content: The Election Commission of India is set to launch ECINET, a unified platform consolidating over 40 existing election-related apps and portals. This single-point app aims to simplify the user experience for nearly 100 crore electors and 26 lakh other stakeholders by providing easy access to electoral data and services.

title: School teacher suspended in UP for remarks against Pahalgam victim
content: Zeba Afroz, a schoolteacher in Sonbhadra, has been suspended following complaints about her "objectionable remarks" on social media concerning a Navy official killed in the Pahalgam terror attack. The basic education officer took immediate action due to the comments being against service rules. An investigation is underway, and further action will be determined based on the investigation report.

title: BSF jawan’s kin see glimmer of hope in Pak trooper’s capture
content: Following the apprehension of a Pakistan Rangers trooper by BSF personnel, the wife of detained BSF jawan Purnam Kumar Shaw expresses renewed hope for her husband's return. Rajani Shaw believes this incident may prompt negotiations between the BSF and Pakistan Rangers, potentially leading to an exchange of prisoners. Frustrated by the lack of progress, she plans to meet with BSF officers in Delhi if there are no updates.

title: Three dead, two hurt in Jharkhand hospital roof collapse
content: In a tragic incident at Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Medical College and Hospital in Jamshedpur, a third-floor balcony collapsed, resulting in the death of three patients and injuries to two others. Authorities have launched an investigation into the accident, and the state government has announced compensation for the victims' families and the injured. Rescue teams safely evacuated ten patients from the affected medicine ward.

title: Woman disrobed, attacked and molested in train, 2 arrested
content: A Thane-based lawyer was allegedly attacked and molested on the Mumbai-Indore Avantika Express. Co-passengers, Imtiyaz Odiya and Rubina Yusuf Pathan, reportedly disrobed her, slashed her with a blade, and threatened her after accusing her of theft. Police arrested Pathan and Odiya, invoking charges including assault and outraging a woman's modesty.

title: IIT-Kharagpur student found dead in hostel
content: Mohammad Asif Qamar, an IIT Kharagpur student, tragically died by suicide in his hostel room during a video call with a friend in Delhi, who alerted authorities. This incident, the second in a short period, has prompted IIT Kharagpur to form a committee to investigate the rising number of suicides on campus. While no prior mental health concerns were identified, Qamar had faced an exam malpractice issue earlier this year.

title: MP police rescue 16 from slavery in Guna, arrest 11
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Guna district, police rescued sixteen mentally challenged and destitute men from modern-day slavery, some held for as long as two decades. They were trapped in a brutal exploitation system called 'Rahua,' forced to work long hours for mere food and shelter, often alongside cattle.

title: INDIA bloc decides to corner Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over corruption, list achievements of Grand Alliance
content: With the Bihar polls due later this year, bloc holds third meeting in Patna; RJD MP Manoj Jha says ‘there is no confusion about leadership’ in the alliance and ‘everyone knows who is their CM face’

title: NCERT new textbooks for Class 7 introduce games, activities rooted in Indian culture
content: From Ghorpadiche Shepoot to Nalugu Rallu Ata, a range of traditional Indian games make their way to the Physical Education book, while tie and dye and puppetry are included in the book for Vocational Education

title: Congress Uttar Pradesh chief stokes row with Rafale toy plane sporting lemon and chillies
content: U.P. Congress President criticises Government’s inaction on Pahalgam terror attack, questions delay in using Rafale jets against terrorists

title: Rajasthan MLA arrested for accepting ₹20 lakh bribe to drop questions in Assembly
content: The Anti-Corruption Bureau sleuths set up a trap to nab the MLA after the mine owner reached out with a complaint

title: Moving from a minority to a majority
content: As tensions rise between India and Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack in Kashmir, Pakistani Hindus in Delhi worry about their kin across the border. Alisha Dutta finds that for them, the thread of their lives runs through the improving or worsening relationship between the neighbouring countries with a history of love and hate

title: Sample fireworks set the sky aflame in Thrissur
content: Compliance with new PESO guidelines ensures safe distance between fireworks and spectators and allow more people to enjoy the show from Swaraj Round

title: A symphony of colour and craft: Chamayam expos attract huge crowds
content: Chamayappuras (exhibition halls of elephant accoutrements) of the Thiruvambady and the Paramekkavu Devaswoms opened on Sunday

title: Anvar’s political base crumples as Trinamool State leadership slams his UDF bid
content: The AITC State leadership has ridiculed Mr. Anvar, suggesting he was desperately trying to join the UDF ahead of the Nilambur byelection

title: Genome-edited seeds to mark beginning of second green revolution: Chouhan
content: These varieties will enhance production and also give environmental gains, says Minister; seeds to be made available to farmers in four-five years

title: Fire during PM’s visit: police launch probe
content: A fire broke out near Gannavaram Airport just before the arrival of Prime Minister; another fire mishap occurred at Tallayapalem village in Guntur district while Modi was delivering his speech

title: Woes of paddy growers continue amid uncertainty over PRS loans
content: Delay in issuing loans against paddy receipt sheets (PRS) impedes preparations for puncha farming season in Kuttanad and Upper Kuttanad

title: Anantapur libraries to become hubs of learning, creativity
content: Joint Collector Shiv Narayan Sharma, convened a meeting with officials from all 79 libraries, the Grandhalaya Samsthas to train children in drawing, painting and other creative disciplines

title: Election Commission to develop new digital interface for voters, other stakeholders
content: The new one-stop platform, ECINET, will integrate and reorient over 40 of the EC’s existing mobile and web applications, including the Voter Helpline app, Voter Turnout app, etc

title: Jaishankar says India is looking for partners, not preachers; highlights New Delhi's 'Russia realism'
content: Europe had ‘entered a certain zone of a reality check’, and must display some sensitivity and mutuality of interest for deeper ties with India, the External Affairs Minister said

title: Rain and thunderstorm take Chennai by surprise
content: The summer showers accompanied by thunder and lightning in several parts of Chennai brought temperature down by a few notches

title: Council of CBSE Schools seeks rollback of tax hike for buses
content: The Council expresses concerns over the financial burden of the MVD’s mandate to install three CCTVs in each bus

title: Kerala unlikely to implead in Waqf Amendment Act case in Supreme Court
content: The Kerala government was one of the first in the country to fiercely oppose the legislation. The Kerala Waqf Board has filed a petition for being impleaded in the case. The court will hear the case on Monday

title: My responsibility to give befitting reply to those who dare to attack our country: Defence Minister Rajnath
content: His remarks came amid expectations of military action by India following the Pahalgam terror attack; Ferozepur Cantonment issues notification for blackout rehearsal from 9-9:30 p.m. on May 4

title: Home Minister rules out NIA probe into Hindutva activist’s murder
content: CM defends plans to set up special security force to curb communal violence in the coastal districts.

title: 339 developmental works in Nellore Rural constituency near completion
content: MLA Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy fixes launch date as May 15;  678 leaders and activists to inaugurate projects

title: BRS demands release of ₹800 crore fee dues of degree colleges
content: Harish Rao says four universities didn’t conduct degree exams so far due to non-release of fee dues to private colleges

title: Under shadow of India-Pak tensions, Rajnath to host Japanese Defence Minister Nakatani for talks on May 5
content: It is learnt that the two sides will also review the situation in the strategic waters of the East and South China Seas, where Beijing has been increasing its military posturing

title: Pacers bury top-seeded Cavs in 3s to take Game 1
content: The Pacers used a barrage of 3-pointers to stun the top-seeded Cavaliers 121-112 in Sunday night's Game 1.

title: Scheffler ties PGA Tour scoring mark in CJ Cup win
content: Scottie Scheffler tied the PGA Tour's 72-hole scoring record Sunday, finishing at 253 and running away with an eight-shot victory at his hometown CJ Cup Byron Nelson.

title: Clark hits vintage 3 in return to Iowa with Fever
content: The fans got exactly what they wanted Sunday at Iowa's Carver-Hawkeye Arena: another vintage Caitlin Clark moment.

title: McLaren's Piastri claims dominant win in Miami
content: Oscar Piastri extended his championship lead to 16 points with victory ahead of teammate Lando Norris at the Miami Grand Prix.

title: Ravens' decision on kicker job to be 'football' call
content: Ravens coach John Harbaugh said whoever wins the team's kicking job will be a decision "based on football."

title: Royals, last in HRs, belt team-record 7 vs. Orioles
content: The Royals, who entered Sunday's game with an MLB-low 18 home runs this season, hit a franchise-record seven homers against the Orioles.

title: Bryson wins LIV Korea with back-9 birdie binge
content: Bryson DeChambeau had six birdies on the final nine holes to shoot a 66 and hold off Crushers GC teammate Charles Howell to win LIV Golf Korea.

title: Sources: Yanks send SS Lombard, 19, to Double-A
content: Top shortstop prospect George Lombard Jr., 19, who hit .329 with 11 stolen bases in 24 games at the High-A level this season, was promoted to Double-A by the New York Yankees on Sunday, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan, bringing him closer to the majors.

title: 💍 Eagles' Brown gets some Legend-ary help
content: The Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver will don his second ring in a several month stretch after helping the Eagles win Super Bowl LIX in February.

title: Kane's trophy pain: A full timeline as Bayern title ends career-long wait for silverware
content: It's finally over! Bayern Munich have won the 2024-25 Bundesliga title, and with it Harry Kane's career-long trophy drought has finally been broken.

title: Weekend review: Arteta zigs while everyone else zags
content: Mikel Arteta was the only UCL title contender to name a full-strength squad over the weekend -- and Arsenal lost. Will his gamble pay-off midweek? That and more in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: Kane's long trophy wait ends as Bayern win title
content: Bayern Munich clinched their 33rd Bundesliga title on Sunday, giving forward Harry Kane the first major trophy of his senior career.

title: Palmer hits back at online 'idiots' as Chelsea win
content: Cole Palmer hit back at social media "idiots" after ending his goal drought in Chelsea's 3-1 win over Liverpool on Sunday.

title: Ancelotti: Clásico will be 'almost' decisive for title
content: Carlo Ancelotti said next weekend's Clásico will be "almost" decisive in the LaLiga title race after Real Madrid beat Celta Vigo 3-2 on Sunday.

title: Buddha's Sacred Jewels, Valued At Rs 107 Crore, To Be Auctioned In Hong Kong
content: A remarkable collection of ancient jewels, once buried beside what were believed to be the Buddha's ashes, is set to be auctioned at Sotheby's in Hong Kong this week.

title: Highlights: Pakistan Opens Firing Across LoC Again, Air Force Chief Meets PM Modi
content: The situation remains tense between India and Pakistan in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack. Facing irrefutable allegations of exporting terror over the decades, Islamabad is now trying diversionary tactics to avoid accountability.

title: Lebanon Begins Local Polls In First Vote Since Israel-Hezbollah War
content: Lebanon on Sunday began the first stage of long-delayed municipal elections, the first vote since a devastating war between Israel and Hezbollah and after a new national government was formed.

title: 14 Children Arrested On Suspicion Of Manslaughter After UK Teen Dies In Fire
content: British police have said 14 children aged between 11 and 14 were arrested in a northeastern English town after a teenage boy died in a fire at an industrial park.

title: Teen Girl Killed By Classmate For Not Talking To Him In Madhya Pradesh: Cops
content: A 17-year-old student was murdered by a classmate after she stopped talking to him in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district, police said on Sunday.

title: 'Factor In Inflation In Aid For Farmers, Like Salaries For MLAs And MPs': Veep
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Sunday advocated Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) in fertiliser subsidies for farmers based on the US pattern and demanded that inflation be factored in while providing financial assistance to agriculturists.

title: Shiv Sena Leader Charged For Molesting Woman Hotelier At Gunpoint In Nagpur
content: Nagpur Police booked a local Shiv Sena functionary for allegedly molesting, cheating, and threatening a woman hotelier at gunpoint, an official said on Sunday.

title: Woman Accuses Actor Ajaz Khan Of Rape, Case Registered
content: A case was registered against actor Ajaz Khan on Sunday after a woman accused him of raping her on the pretext of helping her enter the film industry, an official said.

title: New Law Against Conversion In Chhattisgarh? What Chief Minister Said
content: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai on Sunday announced that his government will introduce a new stringent law to prevent religious conversion of tribal people, and possibly others.

title: Video: Man Alleged To Have Helped Terrorists In J&K Jumps Into River, Drowns
content: A man who gave food and shelter to terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district drowned after he jumped into a river while escaping from the security forces.

title: Telangana High Court's Sitting Judge Justice Maturi Girija Priyadarsini Dies
content: Telangana High Court's sitting judge Justice Maturi Girija Priyadarsini passed away here on Sunday following a brief illness. She was 61.

title: 3 Dead, 60 Hospitalised After 2 Boats Capsize In China: Report
content: Three people died and 60 others were hospitalised after two boats carrying tourists capsized in southwestern China on Sunday, according to state media.

title: Trainer Aircraft Hits Boundary Wall Of UP's Aligarh Airport, Pilot Safe
content: A trainer aircraft from Pioneer Flying Academy was damaged on Sunday after it hit the boundary wall of Dhanipur Airport in Aligarh, officials said.

title: "Stand Fully With Any Action By Government": Priyanka Gandhi On Pahalgam Attack
content: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Sunday said her party would fully support any action the central government takes in response to the terror attack in Pahalgam, in which 26 people were killed.

title: Will "Remain" In NDA, No More About Turns: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, who is looking for a fifth consecutive term in office, on Sunday asserted that he will "remain" in the NDA, crediting the BJP for his rise to power.

title: "Not Something I'm Looking To Do": Trump On Running For 3rd Term
content: US President Donald Trump said in remarks airing Sunday that he does not know whether he must uphold the US Constitution, the nation's founding legal document.

title: Amorim defends young side: UEL final sole focus
content: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim defended making wholesale changes to field the club's youngest ever Premier League lineup in Sunday's 4-3 loss at Brentford.

title: Mbappé brace vs. Celta Vigo keeps title race alive
content: Kylian Mbappé scored two goals as Real Madrid fought off a late comeback attempt from Celta Vigo to secure a 3-2 win on Sunday.

title: Kang's London City Lionesses promoted to WSL
content: London City Lionesses have secured promotion to the Women's Super League (WSL) with a 2-2 draw with fellow contenders Birmingham City.

title: Messi scores in Miami rout to snap losing streak
content: Lionel Messi struck the emphatic final goal as Inter Miami snapped a three-game losing streak with a 4-1 home win over the New York Red Bulls.

title: Solskjaer slams McTominay exit: 'It's beyond me'
content: Former Manchester United head coach Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has criticised Manchester United's decision to transfer Scott McTominay to Napoli last summer.

title: Haeran Ryu goes wire-to-wire in LPGA's return to Utah
content: Haeran Ryu made an 8-foot eagle putt during a flawless back nine that allowed her to pull away Sunday with an 8-under 64, giving her a five-shot victory at the inaugural Black Desert Championship in the LPGA Tour's return to Utah after a 61-year absence.

title: What this monumental coaching change means for San Antonio
content: What's next for San Antonio after Pop's move to the front office? What does Mitch Johnson bring? Our NBA insiders break down the news.

title: Chelsea's midfield powers Blues past Liverpool, toward UCL
content: Enzo Fernández, Moisés Caicedo and Romeo Lavia looked like a UCL midfield in Chelsea's win over Liverpool.

title: Man United ratings: Garnacho, Amad bright sparks; young stars struggle
content: Alejandro Garnacho and Amad made sure Man United's defeat to Brentford didn't look as bad as it could have.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid in talks with Arsenal star Saliba
content: Real Madrid have identified William Saliba as a possible future leader of the club. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Draft tiers at guard
content: Eric Moody goes through the different tiers at the guard position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Luck Index 2025: Who needs luck on their side next season?
content: Turnover luck, coordinator upgrade, transfer portal haul? They all could lead to some upswings for a select few teams.

title: 'We've got the identity that fits us': Wisconsin turns back the clock to move forward
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell is going back to the Badgers' roots in a crucial Year 3 for his program.

title: Terence Crawford is the opponent Canelo Álvarez -- and boxing fans -- need
content: After another less-than-exciting performance, Canelo Alvarez's next fight is finally what boxing fans deserve.

title: Killing Of A Murder-Accused In Mangaluru And A Startling Claim
content: A murder-accused in Karnataka's Mangaluru, Suhas Shetty, was apparently murdered by contract killers who accepted money from the family of one of his victims, sources have said.

title: Goa Health Department Implements "Code Red" Protocol After Temple Stampede
content: In the aftermath of the tragic death of six devotees in a stampede, the Goa health department has announced the phase-wise implementation of a "code red" system in hospitals to ensure swift response to emergencies.

title: Police Foil Bomb Plot At Lady Gaga's Mega Concert In Brazil, 2 Arrested
content: Brazilian police said Sunday they had arrested two people in connection with a foiled plot to attack Lady Gaga's packed mega-concert in Rio de Janeiro.

title: Man, Girlfriend Thrashed In Public By His Parents In UP, Cops Step In
content: A 21-year-old man and his 19-year-old girlfriend were thrashed in public by the former's parents in Kanpur on Friday.

title: Inside Quinn Ewers' draft and post-slide motivation
content: Quinn Ewers was in pain, couldn't eat very much, if at all . he had four wisdom teeth extracted, one left an exposed nerve that had him hurting . his agent felt almost assured he would be picked before the last round .

title: Five rookies with breakout potential
content: the WNBA is a hard league to break into, but rookies are making an impact earlier than ever . in 2023, I recommended not drafting any rookies that weren't the overall no. 1 pick, Aliyah Boston . the 2024 draft class was an outlier from previous history; all four lottery picks averaged over 20 fantasy points per game .

title: After 2 transfers and 5 seasons, the Titans' made Cam Ward's dreams come true
content: cam Ward was drafted by the Titans in the 2025 draft . he played his final college season at a school that's never had a player drafted to the NFL . his early collegiate days began in front of 6,000 people on game days .

title: What must Liverpool address in summer transfer window?
